_header: I have the obit of my lady dear
_description:
A description of his mistress, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 127) — three 11-line stanzas and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
I Haue the obit of my lady dereMade in the chirche of loue full
                    solempnely…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…For ay to kepe ther is no wight so stowtThe hool tresoure of
                    all worldly blys
